posts.name: João Rodrigo Heinzelmann Luckow
posts.cooked:
Hey ChiefDelphi!

As part of our process of training new members for next season, we are building a CRESCENDO Robot (as it was our rookie season and we consider it easier to build than REEFSCAPE).

But as the new students building the shooter system, we discovered that we don’t have any notes anymore, because veteran students thought it will be useless .

We’re trying to find a way to make a Note prototype for testing, so we can shoot something, and we’re looking for suggestions on how to make it.

We have 3d printers (filament and resin), laser cutting machines and a simple CNC.

Thank you!

Edit: I forgot to present my team before, we’re Team 9611 from Santa Catarina/Brazil.

posts.name: João Rodrigo Heinzelmann Luckow
posts.cooked: Also accepting other suggestions on what to make to prepare new students

posts.name: Tim Winters
posts.cooked:
Provide endless hours of ring toss activities with lightweight foam rings! Buy Rainbow Foam Rings for rainy day indoor fun!

Price: USD 59.95

You could buy them? Gopher says $18 fixed shipping and handling.

posts.name: Will
posts.cooked: I have extra Notes in our shop. I can send it or a few to you if that would help.

posts.name: Rod
posts.cooked: Pipe insulation?  Pool noodles?

posts.name: João Rodrigo Heinzelmann Luckow
posts.cooked: We’re from Brazil, so international shipping isn’t viable. But I really thank you for it!

posts.name: João Rodrigo Heinzelmann Luckow
posts.cooked: We were thinking about Pool noodles, but I don’t know if the robot can shoot it without destroying the noodle. But it’ll be our first attempt.

posts.name: Rod
posts.cooked: For something that acts OK, I’d roll a pool noodle or pipe insulation into a ring and wrap it with gaffers tape or duct tape.  The end result will be more durable than a note

posts.name: João Rodrigo Heinzelmann Luckow
posts.cooked: I’m not sure if it have international shipping, and it’ll be really above our budget. But thank you!

posts.name: Tim Winters
posts.cooked:
image 1408×337 30.6 KB

image 1408×337 30.6 KB

image 1408×337 30.6 KB

Supposedly the shipping and handling is fixed at $18USD. I’d be surprised if you were able to make your own notes for cheaper than you could buy them for.

Reaching out to other teams closer to you would also be a good starting point. We were able to get 6 more notes ourselves from a team that no longer needed them

posts.name: João Rodrigo Heinzelmann Luckow
posts.cooked: Certainly it will! Our notes were really fragile. I will try that in the some time.

posts.name: João Rodrigo Heinzelmann Luckow
posts.cooked: $118 dollars is a lot here and we can’t spend that with our small project. I’m looking for some workaround that should work for our shooter and future intake while keeping the costs low. The pool noodles may be an idea for it.

posts.name: João Rodrigo Heinzelmann Luckow
posts.cooked: I also tried looking in some sport stores here but didn’t find anything.

posts.name: Pedro Braga
posts.cooked:
Doing a quick search online, I was able to find a pack of 10 pool noodles for R$56,90 with free shipping. At current exchange rates, that’s only about 10 USD.

They probably won’t end up being the most accurate notes ever, but considering even official notes ended up with a few chunks missing after a match or two, it’ll just add to the authenticity.

posts.name: Tim Winters
posts.cooked: Pool noodles are just much thicker than the notes, and also don’t bend well.

posts.name: Pedro Braga
posts.cooked:
Considering it’s a training exercise, is it really that bad if the dimensions are a little off?

As long as you build your robot considering your custom game piece’s actual dimensions, it would probably work fine.

posts.name: Rod
posts.cooked: foam pipe insulation from the hardware store is similar to pool noodles, but comes in different sizes to match different pipes.  There’s also a rubber version that is MUCH closer to the texture of the notes. https://www.lowes.com/pd/Frost-King-1-2-in-x-6-ft-Rubber-Plumbing-Tubular-Pipe-Insulation/3132405

posts.name: Jeremiah Johnson
posts.cooked:
Are you replicating your 2024 robot because it is easier to replicate or are you designing a new robot to perform the tasks of 2024?

If the latter, could you just create a new “game” similar to Crescendo with a new game piece?

posts.name: João Rodrigo Heinzelmann Luckow
posts.cooked: We were almost ending our shooter, but if we need it we can rebuild with custom dimensions.

posts.name: João Rodrigo Heinzelmann Luckow
posts.cooked:
We started with the idea of replicating our 2024 robot, but some new students started making some improvements and creating new mechanisms in CAD, so we want to test it also.

I really like the note as a game piece, and we already started building it, but we’re open for suggestions!

data.fancy_title: Best way to DIY a Crescendo Note
data.title: Best way to DIY a Crescendo Note
